questions.uddipok:
Change the narrative style of the following text.
The class teacher said. "Do you know what dengue is?" "No. sir, please tell us about it clearly," said the students. "It's a disease which is caused by a mosquito named Aedes." "How can we save us from it?" asked the students. "By keeping us and our environment neat and clean we can save us from it," said the class teacher.

sub_questions.explanation: The class teacher asked the students if they knew what dengue was. The students politely replied in the negative and requested him/her to tell them about it clearly. Then the class teacher told the students that it was a disease which was caused by a mosquito named Aedes. After that, the students wanted to know how they could save them from it. The class teacher replied that they could save them from it by keeping them and their environment neat and clean.

questions.uddipok:
Change the sentences according to directions.
a) Once upon a time there was a little girl named Tarin. (Compound)
b) Though she was a nice little girl, she was not an ordinary child. (Simple)
c) She passed her time in reading and writing.(Interrogative)
d) Her parents liked her very much. (Negative)
e) Everyone praised her, (Passive)
f) She was very attentive to her study. (Exclamatory)
g) She also helped her mother in her free time.(Complex)
h) She never told a lie. (Interrogative)
i) She was one of the most intelligent girls in the school. (Positive)
j) She worked hard to shine in life. (Complex)

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Once upon a time there was a little girl and her name was Tarin.
(b) In spite of being a nice little girl, she was not an ordinary child.
(c) Didn't she pass her time in reading and writing?
(d) Her parents did not dislike her at all.
(e) She was praised by everyone.
(f) How attentive she was to her study!
(g) When she was free, she also helped her mother.
(h) Did she ever tell a lie?
(i) Very few girls in the school were as intelligent as she.
(j) She worked hard so that she could shine in life.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on ' A Good Teacher '.

sub_questions.explanation: A good teacher is not just someone who imparts knowledge but also someone who inspires and motivates students to reach their full potential. A good teacher is patient, understanding, and empathetic, always willing to listen to their students and offer guidance. They create a positive and encouraging learning environment where students feel comfortable asking questions, making mistakes, and growing. Such teachers are well-prepared, organized, and passionate about the subjects they teach, and they make learning enjoyable by using creative methods and real-life examples. Beyond academics, a good teacher also helps shape a student's character by teaching important values such as respect, responsibility, and perseverance. They play a vital role in building a student’s confidence, nurturing their curiosity, and instilling a love for learning that lasts a lifetime. Ultimately, a good teacher leaves a lasting impact on their students, not only in the classroom but also in their lives.

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on ' Value of Time' .

sub_questions.explanation:
Value of Time
One of the most valuable things a human being can have in life is time. It is one fugitive element that is always running forward. It never breaks its onward march. It is wise to make its proper use in our life. There is no certainty that we will live tomorrow and do our today's work in future, For this, present moment is the most valuable moment in our life and we must utilize it.
Every work has its proper time and we must complete. it in time. Any negligence or delay may bring us failure. The habit of, idleness is a great enemy to the way of our success and progress. To make life successful and fruitfuil, we must make the proper úse of our time. For this, we should sit to study when it is time for study, play when it is time for it etc.
